pesticide.PPE: Applicators and other handlers must wear: Coveralls worn over long-sleeved shirt, long pants; Chemical-resistant gloves made of any waterproof material (such as polyethylene or polyvinyl chloride); Protective eyewear; Chemical resistant footwear and socks. Remove PPE immediately after handling this product. Wash the outside of gloves before removing. As soon as possible, wash thoroughly and change into clean clothing. Do not allow contact of contaminated clothing with unprotected skin. Discard clothing and other absorbent materials that have been drenched or heavily contaminated with this product’s concentrate. Do not reuse them. Follow manufacturer’s instructions for cleaning/maintaining PPE. If no such instructions for washables exist, use detergent and hot water. Keep and wash PPE separately from other laundry.

Active_Ingredients.name: Fluazinam
Active_Ingredients.mode_Of_Action: Multi-site mode of action (uncoupler of oxidative phosphorylation)

Safety_Information.general_Info: CAUTION: Harmful if swallowed. Harmful if absorbed through skin. Harmful if inhaled. Avoid contact with skin, eyes, or clothing. Avoid breathing spray mist. Prolonged or frequently repeated skin contact may cause allergic reactions in some individuals. Wash thoroughly with soap and water after handling. Remove contaminated clothing and wash before use. Do not take internally.
Safety_Information.if_Swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything to an unconscious person.
Safety_Information.if_Inhaled: Move person to fresh air. If person is not breathing, call 911 or an ambulance, then give artificial respiration, preferably by mouth-to-mouth, if possible. Call a poison control center or doctor for further treatment advice.
Safety_Information.if_On_Skin: Take off contaminated clothing. Rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. Call poison control center or doctor for treatment advice.
Safety_Information.physician_Note: Probable mucosal damage may contraindicate the use of gastric lavage.
